**Core Domain Model:**

| Resource | Key Properties | Relationship |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **[Resource A]** | `Property 1`, `Property 2` | One A can have **Many** Bs. |
| **[Resource B]** | `Property 1`, `Property 2`, `Foreign Key` | **Many** Bs belong to **One** A. |

## üéì Concepts to Master

**What specific programming concepts will we learn?**

*Order matters - concepts should build on each other.*

1. **[Foundation Concept 1]** - e.g., Project scaffolding and domain modeling
2. **[Foundation Concept 2]** - e.g., API layer and dependency injection
3. **[Intermediate Concept 1]** - e.g., Data transfer objects and validation
4. **[Intermediate Concept 2]** - e.g., Entity Framework and migrations
5. **[Advanced Concept 1]** - e.g., Authentication and authorization
6. **[Advanced Concept 2]** - e.g., Testing strategies (unit, integration)

## ‚úÖ Success Criteria

**How will we know we've succeeded?**

- [ ] I can build a complete [application type] from scratch without guidance

- [ ] I can extend the project with new features confidently
